title: Smyth County teen dies from gunshot wound sustained during Russian roulette
content:
An 18-year-old man from Chilhowie died Sunday evening from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound suffered during a solo game of Russian roulette.
According to Saltville Assistant Police Chief Erik Puckett, the incident happened around 7:15 p.m. Police were called to the 400 block of North Fork Apartments on Elizabeth Street, where Donovan Wade Puckett (no relation to the assistant police chief) had apparently shot himself with a .357 Magnum revolver.
Asst. Chief Puckett said witnesses were present but no one else was participating in the game. The gun did not belong to the victim but he was in possession of it. Puckett said it is not illegal for an 18-year-old to have possession of a gun but must be 21 to purchase and register a handgun. Puckett said there is no suspicion of a crime involving the handgun.
The victim’s body was transported to the western lab of the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in Roanoke for autopsy. Asst. Chief Puckett said there was no information available on the presence of drugs or alcohol, but blood tests would be done as part of the autopsy. The investigation is continuing.
The Saltville Police Department was assisted by the Chilhowie Police Department, Smyth County Sheriff’s Office and Virginia State Police. The Saltville Rescue Squad also responded.
